column1: hi everyone!My friend and I are thinking of going to Senegal this summer and we dont know what diseases we should get vaccinated against. Can someone help us in this please?Thank you :)
Senegal require yellow fever vaccine, other is optional. Ask your vaccine central what they recommend you.

The main required vaccines are: tiroïd,, yellow fever, hepatis A, hepatis B,meningitis, poliomyelitis, tetanus ,diphteria, pertussis. The malaria vaccine is not available yet you have to approach your doctor for preventions.

I don't think they required it, only recommend it: As long as visitors come from areas with yellow fever or typhoid epidemics, it requires some vaccines.But yellow fever, malaria, cholera and typhoid vaccines are recommended.There is a difference between the recommended and required.
So yellow fever is the only one required, right? (just checking that I got you guys right)
Yes, it is, but actually nobody on the border or airport checked it LOL
